content:
Nice clash, but it's a bit hard to understand.

The biggest issue that I think needs to be clarified is that you say "Lastly for each of the given numbers, add it to the result if that number is in the string version of result (for example 5 is in 258 so 263)."
But then you don't explain which result to use (e.g.) for the second number if the result increased after the first number. For example if the result was 258 and the first number was 5, then the result is now 263, then if the next number is 3, it's unclear whether to add it now, since 3 is in "263" but not in "258".
What your code and solutions assume is that the result before the numbers are added is what the numbers should be compared to, but in my clash I assumed that it would be iterative and got stuck for a short time trying to debug this.

That's the other problem with the clash, because there are so many steps, it's very hard to debug where something went wrong. It would be better to not jump so quickly to such complicated test cases. "qwerty" would be a good early test, rather than starting with "Hello World!", for example.

Overall, it's fun but I think it's quite hard to understand and debug, and it would be good to clarify how the adding of numbers is dependent on the initial value of the result before any numbers are added. I came first in my Fastest mode clash, with 2 bots getting 100%, then all 3 human players getting 0%. :/

https://www.codingame.com/clashofcode/clash/report/380137387544b3df0fd170851a901616d51e6d0

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is simpler than I thought. When I first read "add the ASCII value to the result", I thought about modifying the string, but it turned out to be just a sum of ASCII values.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun challenge that can be solved in a few minutes, but complex enough to make you think about it
this could be good in speed or code length but too difficult in reverse
Very fun, the explanations are clear, very good for a clash of easy to medium difficulty

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it made me use my brain and find solution made me happy
This clash is simple and quick to comprehend, making it an interesting challenge that combines several concepts. The difficulty level is well-balanced for a clash game. There are enough tests.

Goal
* I don't understand the last sentence.

Input
* Please rewrite all lines in this format:

<<Line ?>>: A string/An integer [[variable_name]] for [insert description here]

(The last one would be <<Next [[N]] lines>>.)

Please refer to and follow the example here:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

Thanks.

Thank you. Now I understand better what's required. Here are some additional matters to follow up:

Title
* Suggest to delete the colon (:).

Goal
* Please delete "or word".

* Please change "every other character" to "all other characters" (because "every other" can mean "alternate").

* Please change "add given numbers besides N (Second line)" to "for each of the given numbers, add it".

Cases
* Please revise the input of Test 6 and remove all non-ASCII characters, because they aren't shown properly in the CodinGame console.

Thanks again.

Only one point (not critical):

Title
* Suggest to delete the colon (:).

Thanks.
